Great on a Sunday!!. A great area to walk around, see art, eat and shop. On Sunday everything is open (which is rare in Paris). You can easily spend a few hours here, alone, with family, friends or just a nice romantic day with someone.
A Nice Stroll. We ended up here quite by accident and strolled through the streets. The shopping was actually reasonable and relatively unhassled. The food was good and pleasantly served.

The best place to stay in Paris. This was not our first visit to Paris, not even our fifth, we come here often, but we never stayed in The Marais. This time we rented a flat in the Marias through AirBNB and we love it!!! The small streets, the old houses with the big courtyards, the galleries, the scene, just perfect.
Tour of le marais. Took a walking tour of le marais and it was a lovely afternoon there are many shops and restaurants with great food and many things to see

Best district in Paris!. Cute, quintessential Paris cobblestone streets, boutique stores and wonderful restaurants. We went to the Marais on Sunday when everything in other arrondissments were closed. Marais is open on Sunday. It's adorable! It's slower than the other districts and what you imagine Paris to be. It's just on the other side of the very commercial rue de Rivioli. Just keep going through that chaos and then all of a sudden the chaos is gone and you are in true Paris. We took the 4 metro from Saint Germain des Pres. It was really easy. You won't want to miss this area.

Amazing Neighborhood. A beautiful, historical, vibrant neighborhood, with museums, great shops and restaurants, Le Marais is one of my favorite arrondissments in Paris. I love Rue de Rosiers and the amazing L'as du Fallafel. An amazing area to wander around - don't miss out!

Love this district. Hole in the wall shops, great restaurants and brasseries, quaint cobble stone back streets Marais is also very central to many attractions, only 15 euro taxi to Eiffel Tower and on the blue line route for hop on hop off

True Paris experience. We stayed in an apartment on Rue Chapon and enjoyed walking the narrow streets with beautiful and interesting shops. Lots of cafes and parks as well as museums and art galleries. It felt like the true Paris and not touristy like more popular areas. Highly recommend this central area as only half hour walk to The Louvre or 20mins to Notre Dame.

Best Walkimg and People Watching. We walked the entire arrondisement--at least it felt like it-- as we took twists and turns and just enjoyed exploring. Recommend MERCI for a nice latte and fresh shopping experience.

Girls Family Birthday Trip. It's was a family( two sisters and their daughter and daughter-in-law, ages 34 to 68)We love exploring and shopping here. Favorite thing was a food tour with Paris By Mouth!!

The real Paris. We wandered the streets towards the Pompidou centre and found quaint buildings, peaceful parks in unexpected places and lovely eateries and bars and very few tourists. A relaxing stroll before flight home.
a very hip and charming district. many eating joints around the area. stayed with a french lady in one of those old apartments. was quite an experience!

Calmer and quieter section of Paris. Like an enclave within the hustle and bustle of the big city, Le Marais seemed like an escape. Although catering to tourists, the area did not have a touristy feel to it. Just what I was looking for!

The feel of an old French village. . Like going back in time. Great shopping, both name brands and many local and unique shops. The old Jewish section has really good eating options, with the world's best falafel. Wonderful bakeries line the blocks. You can spend a fun afternoon there. Most stores open Sunday.

All we wanted from the Parisian shopping. Lovely area with romantic winding streets and vintage shopping. The central area was a bit crowded with tourists but we didn't mind, the amazing atmosphere, architecture and lovely shops made us forget all about tourism. Sitting at a local café sipping a glass of wine each we felt more continental than we had at any other time during our trip.
Visit with friends . This part of Paris we had visited with friends. A very nice inspiring part of Paris an absolute must do! Nice boutiques and small restaurants.

Great shops and walking. I love this area of Pris for shopping and walking. My favorite vintage Come On Eileen is here and several others. Great window shopping, fun restaurants. similiar feel to Soho in New York, maybe a little cooler and less discovered.

Always delights . It's a delightful area of Paris. Tiny streets and bijou shops are in contrast to the wide boulevards and avenues of the Haussmann Paris. Shopping is great in BHV - I mean how many department stores have a hardware department - it's in the basement but it's très chic! Good restaurants and indoor markets. Little delights at every turn.

Rented apartment in Marais---great area!. We stayed in the Marais district. It is great! Wonderful shops and restaurants, great vibe, quiet, away from tourist area yet close to metro stops and a 25 minute walk to Notre Dame. Wonderful place to hang out, great shopping and interesting history with the Jewish community. Two of the best crepe places in Paris are here.

Beautiful architecture, graceful mansions and adorable shops. The Marais neighborhood is so pretty and fun to walk through. Dripping with old-world Parisian charm, this area delights with it's gorgeous mansions, boutique shops and warm, inviting eateries.
We enjoyed a quiet picnic snack in complete solitude at the Place des Vosgues on a chilly Fall afternoon.

Another face of Paris. le Marais brings you a different face of Paris. This is Paris where "normal" people live and go to work. Small shops, creative places, small restaurants and cosy pubs. But also Place des Vosges with its contemporary art galleries, its playing ground for families with children from the neighbourhood. Life at Le Marais is slower than in downtown Paris. We love this area.

Terrific neighborhood. We stayed in this neighborhood for a week during our recent Spring Break vacation. We loved this area! There's a different and interesting restaurant every few steps - from traditional French to Italian to Falafel and Israeli food -- and we were never disappointed. It's a fun, interesting area with lots of shopping, both upscale and not-so-upscale. It's close to grocery stores and a great department store as well as 2 metro stops. Can't wait to go again!
Rain or shine so much to see. This arrondissement has it all, beautiful squares, shopping, food especially great falafel. Make sure you see the Victor Hugo house.

great walk with hidden rabbit holes. This is a great area to walk. You can get down at saint paul metro stop and walk around from there. We walked to village saint paul where there are narrow streets and courtyards where artists display their works. Its a nice way to spend afternoon time in paris. I would not recommend staying here for the first timer. If its your second orthird trip you can consider staying in this area.

Best area to spend a day in Paris . If I had to recommend only one area of Paris it would be that one... You will experience a real parisian day with lots of nice restaurant café and bar but also lots of museums (most of them are free look out for musée de la mairie de Paris)... Also if you are there visit the uniqlo shop in Rue des franc bourgeois... Really cool building!
Best place to hang out in Paris. The Marais is the Parisian culture, the place to be, the place to see. See Place des Vosges, stroll to see the art galleries. Get yourself lost there.

walking around le marais. exciting and vibrant as always
new artist driven shops
place des vosges and surroundings are fabulous
the archives and hotel sully are marvelous.

The ancient heart of Paris with small streets and old houses. This quarter is very easygoing, with still changing showrooms of mode, jewels, creative things, exhibitions and funny bars or restaurants. A lot of miscellaneous museums, e.g. Picasso Museum or "Musée de la Shoah" ...

A Great Area For a Walk. We thoroughly enjoyed walking around Le Marais each day we were in Paris, as our apartment bordered this neighborhood. Lots of great restaurants - particularly if you love falafel like I do!
Amazing neighbourhood. First stay in Le Marais. Fantastic food, people, atmosphere. Great for lazy hours of people watching outside one of the many cafes that line the streets

Great neighborhood to stay in. Second time staying in the Marais, and love it. Great location, as you are walking distance from Metro stations, the Islands and Notre Dame, Bastille, Pompidou Center, Place du Vosges, etc. Plus, the district is filled with great restaurants, cafes and shops. Fun to spend an afternoon just wandering the Marais. Stayed at Hotel Duo, which was great....block from Hotel d'Ville.

unique atmosphere. Le Marais is a unique place in the world in a very unique city. Walk in this place make me feel happy. you can lost the way by seeing on the sky or in the windows of cool café or shop. Another place must go in Paris.

A lovely and interesting part of Paris away from the tourist hordes. The Marais has countless small shops (many selling antiques) and restaurants and several excellent museums including the Musee de Picasso. The maze of backstreets have a lovely atmosphere and it feels very unspoilt. Place des Voges is worth a visit on its own - a beautiful square with a public park in the middle. Well worth half a day or more of your visit to Paris.

in summary , we had a great time walking, exploring and stumbling into fabulous shops.. never knew about this place, was here the day before we left and i would certainly have planned it better had i known about this place. we kinda went here by accident. its a beautiful jewish quarter with lots and lots of shops of all kinds. fashionable branded shops, local boutiques and ateliers and little quaint cafes and jewish cafes etc. this place literally has it all.you have to just walk and discover it for yourself. only downer is if it was raining as there is no shade, you are just walking in the pavement. we were there for 4 hours and it was not enough:( in the inner section are small shops as you radiate outward there are bigger shops and department stores for men and women. i was going bonkers!id plan it better next time. ideally id be here before lunch which is at around 1130. shops here mostly open by 11 anyway so you can do a but of exploring before lunch time and continue to attack after:)a la marais, i will be back

Walking tour. Never ending amount of history, locales, shops, smells, sights, sound... I enjoyed it so much I stayed and stayed. Be sure to check out the small shops. You can see the old wall of Paris in many places.
Happy wanderers. Great area for mooching. Little shops, cafes etc. Lots of ethnic food shops.Great for rustic soup or quiche lunches. A bit of old Paris that Napoleon didn't get his hands on!
A great lively area of Paris!. We always walk through the Marais when we visit Paris. Beautiful architecture, many local shops, lively streets and eateries. Don't miss it when visiting Paris.

Favourite district . This is one of the top districts that I really enjoy walking and never get bored. It is packed of history and a very lively as well mostly on Sunday's. I would rather recommend to walkabout in this area by dawn or very late night (it is safe to walk) so that you can enjoy the architecture also this area holds very nice cafes and restaurants as well as hidden bar by marie du 3eme called candelaria
Enjoy everything if you can fit it in. An interesting quiky part of Paris that is to be, like a good wine savoured. There is much to enjoy here if you are willing to try something new.

One of the best arrondissement in Paris . I come there each time I am in Paris and it is still amazing! Plenty of boutiques, art galleries and cafés. Being pedestrian for the weekend makes it even better to stroll around the small streets.Lots of charme

Don't miss it.. A once neighborhood of the working class and left very much to it's own devises, it suddenly became a trendy place to live, open a business along side the Jewish Quarter. Like Chueca in Madrid it is very Gay orientated especially at night with good Cafés, Bistros and shops to visit. Plus Museums and sites. Le Marais is a area to wander and lose yourself in the back streets an be surprised at every turn.

Best shopping in the most gorgeous surroundings. You can't go wrong in the Marais. Loads of great boutiques , vintage stores, known retailer and gorgeous cafes as well as some great craft hipster coffee spots. In the most beautiful village like area. A trip to Paris is not complete without an afternoon meandering around the Marais and a pop into the marche enfants rouge. Suggestions : boot cafe or foundation cafe for coffee.

A Must See Neighborhood. It's too bad Rick Steves only gives this neighborhood a "two" for "must sees." His walking tour in his pocket Paris guide of it is fabulous. Crowded and lively, start at one of the cafes. Then it's on to a beautiful public square near Victor Hugo's house, art galleries, fashionable stores, and of course the Jewish part of the neighborhood with Judaica shops, bakeries, and several falafal stands. "The best falafel in the world," said one of the servers taking pre-orders from the long line of people. I asked, "What about in Israel?" And he said, "Better, because we are in France where we know food!" We had just eaten too many hamentashen (cookies for the Jewish holiday of Purim) from a bakery to fit in falafel, but since the hamentashen were the best I ever had (including my mother's and 2 Purims spent in Israel), I believe him!

My favourite area!. Spent plenty time in le Marais, in fact most of the Easter weekend. I love this part of Paris, it feels authentic, friendly people, nice bars and restaurants and unique shops. My favourite is mariage freres the shop selling specialty teas. I had to buy the new Darjeeling first flush of 2016 grand cru!

Great area to stay!. This is my first visit to Paris! We stayed in a little apartment in Bastille (check out the Sunday market!!), which was very well situated and communicated: lines 1, 5 and 8 will take you to many central places in Paris.The feeling of the area was young and fun, but also had a neighborhood feeling. You could find everything around, from bakeries to have breakfast and buy bread, supermarkets and specialized stores, to night clubs and restaurants. It felt like we got the not-so-touristy Paris experience.
Love this area!. Lot of boutiques,nice food place places, easy going place. Just nice to walk about and get lost:) if you are around for brunch try Derrière !

An ancient neighborhood with a great modern vibe. Close to the main tourist sites, but beter.. Le Marais was one of the orignal aristocratic areas, then Jewish, then rundown, now vibrant. Go walk around, eat great food, shop Supreme, Superdry, etc. Amazing how many visitors miss this area so close to Notre Dame and Bastille.
Fabulous walking district. Le Marais is a fabulous area with great shops, bars and restaurants. People watching is the best, especially from the outdoor patio at Les Philosophes.

Apartment in du Temple. We stayed in Le Marais for about a week. The area is safe central. We traveled mainly by train which was easy to access from our apartment, including an abundance of restaurants and Superettes. Some nights we returned home in the early hours of the morning to find old ladies walking their dogs and families returning home just to reiterate how safe the area is.

My favourite area in Paris. The Marais is a large area of Paris and there is so much to see and do there. I love to stay in the northern part where more Parisiens live and it is close walking distance to everything. Great food, great shopping.

Très très chic. This is by far the loveliest neighbourhood in Paris, Le Marais is a must for a stroll while enjoying an ice cream and some window shopping. There are plenty of bars where you can sit back and relax while enjoying a drink and people watching. The architecture is simply lovely. This is a good area to have a cocktail and dinner as well. You could spend a whole day in Le Marais without feeling the need of going anywhere else in Paris. Have fun!

fabulous but try to get some recommendations first. We loved this area for it's small, cool shops and the overall feel. I loved not seeing a huge starbucks or H&M... and feeling just a little less global for a few minutes. We went to specifically find the oldest candle shop in paris and wished we had done a little homework on where else to go and eat while there. Although everything we stumbled upon was great so there's a lot of fun in that as well. Wandering around le marais is a treat.

Marais Love.... We always rent an apartment in Le Marais when in Paris, we love this areas vibe so much. We love the small design boutiques, the narrow streets, the wonderful restaurants, the cool art galleries and simply the overall groove of this neighborhood. It is Also very convenient to get anywhere in Paris from here, both by foot or by metro.

A centrally located neighborhood with lots to do. We stayed near the hotel de ville and we felt we were centrally located. Easy access to metros and walking distance to many tourist areas. In addition, this area has a "local" feel. Although there are many tourists you do feel as if you are taking part in daily Parisian life. There are many restaurants and cafes and, if you're looking for night life, we found many local bars and pubs along rue des Lombards. My daughter lives in Manhattan and this area had the feel of downtown NYC.

Best Neighborhood in Paris . Our favourite place in Paris. Nice shops and restaurants, with original French style. Great bakeries, traditional French food. Famous falafel shops and patisseries as well. It is a "must" ..!! Keep in mind that most shops in Le Marais are open in Sunday!!
Le Marais, Le Marais..... I love walking through Marais on my way to town or back to 11th arr. The vibe, the sounds, it's Paris.

Wonderful area. My favourite place in Paris. Great quirky shops and restaurants, open on Sunday, which is unusual in Paris. Just great to wander and look at people, lots of cafes - stop for coffee. Famous falafel shops and Jewish bakeries.

Where to go to see the Paris trends. It is the place to find the best trends of Paris , you.ll find everything you can go for , trendy restaurants,groceries, Fashion , muséums etc etc . A real pleasure to walk around and find treasures. It is even Mostly open sunday.

3 days in 1K. The room is nice suite was large confortable and contemporain style. Staff is quiet nice but during 3 days no internet!
And it seems not really efforts from management to fix this problem! Some details on maintenance gave the impression left behind its glorious time. Please keep update your maintenance!
Visited as recommended. It was a nice area for shops, and cafe's. was not as good as i expected it to be, lovely cake shops but not many ofering you to sit in.

Fabulous for dining, shopping, and walking about. We love the Marais area because it has so many little shops, wonderful restaurants, expensive chocolate shops, tempting bakeries, and a Jewish spree with delicious latkes, spreads, and breads. It isn't too cheap but the quality is very good.Within 10 minutes one can walk from Notre Dame to the Marais via Rue Franc Bourgeoise which eventually turns into Rue Rambuteau.In addition we love how we can get to Rue Montorgueil, Rue Rivoli with BHV department store, and metro stations like Chatelet Les Halles and St Paul so conveniently. We love the Marais!

Make your own discoveries-wander. This is a happening area and a great place to wander. I also suggest that you go on the days there is a market at the Bastille and use the time to absorb the vibe of Paris.
Boring. Went on a Sunday. Not sure if that's why but the entire place seemed pretty boring to me. Preferred the shopping streets like Rennes over this.

Le Marais, One of the Typical Burroughs of Paris. Located not far away from the Seine River, Le Marais provides a typical Parisian way of life. Many cafés and restaurant with cuisine from all around the world as well as fashion boutiques. The burrough is many made of small streets with very well preserved and renovated buildings from the XVIth, XVIIth and XVIIIth centuries. Le Marais is considered as the Parisian gay community as well as the eastern european jewish living center.

Great Neighborhood. We rented an apartment here for a week. Close to sights, lots of food and shops. The small street are fun to wander through to see beautiful buildings. Walked to Notre Dame and the Louvre.

Wonderful, non-touristy part of Paris. We tented an apartment in the Haute Marais for a week in March near the Arts et Metier metro stop. Lots of restaurants and shops, lots activity everywhere - mostly young Parisians.

Walking thru Le Marais . All I can say it's very French very wonderful and after experience it for yourself replaced grab lunch or dinner look for restaurants in the back alleys use trip advisor to help you.

A place to go for a great afternoon in Paris. We love the vibe of the Marais for shopping, eating & simply meandering the tiny streets. The mix & mingle of Parisians & tourists is more subtle here. You really feel apart of the Parisian life here, sharing space in their cafes, restaurants, unique boutiques, etc. It is always an enjoyable way to spend an afternoon in Paris!

A must. Paris has so much to offer, to a point where it gets overwhelming. That's when Marais is where you want to be. This part of Paris simply calms you down, with its beautiful squares, charming streets and calm feel. This is where you want to get lost for the sake of getting lost, and just keep strolling.

Favorite neighborhood. This is the area we stayed in and loved it. It also worth a visit just to walk the streets. There are many small local boutiques to view and shop. This is a great area to just walk and explore. On Sunday all the stores are open and many of the streets are pedestrian only for the day, so Sunday is the best day to explore this area.

Dynamic and charming area of an incredible city. I live in the Marais and love it so much. It's such a lively and beautiful neighbourhood with no shortage of cafes, restaurants, and shops. Drop by Pierre Hermé for a few of the city's best macarons or pick up falafel on the famous Rue de Rosiers and then spend some time in Place de Vosges.
Wonderful. Wonderful place full of atmosphere, in particular rue de rosiers. Not to be visited on a Saturday, when the majority of the shops are closed.
Great area to stay in lots of late night bars. Great area to stay in . plenty of bars and places to eat . 10 minute walk to Notre dame and the Latin quarter

Fascinating. Once more in Le Marais and once more we really enjoyed it. By far, this is my favorite neighborhood in Paris, and during the weekend it is even more fascinating. Very Parisien, instead the tons of tourists and very authentic. We had a reservation for brunch in a charming cafe in the area and spend around five hours in total in Marais, time well spended. It combines everything you are looking for, restaurants, cafes, historic mansions, museums and charming boutiques. Totally recommended!

a beautiful old neighborhood. This is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Paris and definitely worth a visit. Dont miss the two biggest attractions - Place des Vosges - a beautiful 18th century square where Voltaire's house, now a museum is worth a visit. And rue des Rosiers - one of the oldest Jewish districts. also rue des Francs Bourgeois for the fantastic boutiques.
Don't tell anyone. What a lovely mix of old and new. Lovely architecture. Small boutiques, bistros, cafes and bars. Beautiful public spaces and squares. Place des Vosges,gorgeous!

Big Crowds on Weekends. The crowds are there for a reason: there are wonderful museums (Picasso, Carnavalet, to name just two), shops of all kinds (from Fendi, Valentino, Kors and the rest to clever little boutiques for clothing and gifts), atmospheric restaurants, quaint narrow streets, and sidewalk cafes. About the latter: everyone seems to smoke in the cafes, and it can be unpleasant outdoors if you don't. In fact, walking on the narrow streets you'll be treated to a lot of cigarette smoke anyway, much of it emanating from the cafes and much from passers-by. Sit indoors to avoid it when eating. Point two: the Marais is the epicenter of gay life in Paris, and some streets and corners get nearly blocked on weekend nights by large groups of gay men simply congregating, smoking and having a good time. If that makes you uncomfortable, stay away, but you'll be missing a scene that is intrinsic to the Marais.

Cool part of town. Picasso Museum and Cemetiere were excellent places to visit. Many restaurants. Wonderful shops to grab a sandwich or a pastry. We stayed at the Hotel Georgette which is just east of La Marais and loved our stay there.

If you go to Paris: stay in Le Marais!. Le Marais is my favorite neighborhood in Paris. Even though it is very touristy as well, there are still some spots for locals. You just need to know them. Very good atmosphere, nice bars, coffee shops, brunch spots, restaurants and great shopping, open on Sundays! Stunning mansions and gardens and great small museums (Picasso, Carnavalet, Victor Hugo...). If you go to Paris: stay in Le Marais!

Une Flânerie dans Le Marais. The Marais offers those who like to stroll about and those who like to shop as well as those who like looking at buildings, plenty to see and enjoy. Of course there are also plenty of places to eat on the way. Do take your time and do some people watching too. rue des Rosiers is a must but it is good to take an unexpected turn and enjoy something different. Of course there are a lot of tourists but Le Marias attracts parisians too. Don't forget the Place des Vosges of course.

Get a Feel for the Real Paris. Le Marais is a one of the loveliest neighborhoods in Paris. Once the Jewish Quarter, it is now ethnically diverse replete with shops, restaurants, and just a short distance to the Notre Dame. Spend an afternood waling, eating, and people-watching.

A visual feast. I always stay in an apartment in Le Marais when I visit Paris, and this visit was no exception. Le Marais is very popular with Jews and Gays, but all are of course welcome. When all of the department stores in Paris are closed on Sundays, people flock to shop in the small unique shops in Le Marais. There are many cafes and restaurants, bars and patisseries. Great place to relax at an outside cafe table, enjoy a glass of whatever, and people watch. This area is very safe, day and night, but always beware of pic-pockets in Paris. They are everywhere.

lovet this area. full of nice restaurants, trendy shops, near Place the Voges and Place the la Bastille, if you have been in Paris few times and you want to see a different area I would totally recommend to stay around Marais!
Nice place to Stroll. Accidentally passed by this area without much expectation. It turned out to be a memorable one with many shops offering good buy.

Changing to a pseudo av montaigne. For those of you who liked the area because of its bohemian feel, with every religion, confession, orientation and style bring représentés, jury up, Because the main protagonistes such as the BHV are doing all the can to elevate in luxury style, this changing the charming feel.It's working and soon the partying and shopping extravaganza will be past...

Love it!. Probably the best alternative and boutique shopping in Paris!
& a great place to sit and have breakfast or dinner - even in the cold/rain (whoever invented overhead heaters is a genius!)

So many choioces. It's what's left of old Paris and with many food and shopping choices and of course the Picasso museum. And then there's Schwartzs' NY Jewish Deli if you really need a hot dog or a hint of an America that's long since gone by.

Very lively. One of the best area in Paris.
Very lively and with good vibe!
You can find a lot of hidden gems, either a restaurant, hotel or shop!!!
Cannot avoid to come any time you come to Paris!!

Alive. The marais is a really nice quarter of Paris. I love the vibe of this place and a great plus is that some stores are open on Sundays there !! I would recommend this area for day time walks and nights out.

Ideal area to stay in . Love this part of Paris. Great for shopping, eating and staying. Popular with locals and some tourists. If you want to experience Paris away from the usual tourist traps then this area is ideal.

One of the few areas open on a Sunday.. Top things to eat are: Pierre Herme macaron, L'as du fallafel and miznon (this place is soooo good). If you don't like crowds, avoid this area on the weekends. The streets can get really packed!
An authentic place. It's a small but an authentic place of old Paris. It's the street of art. Proud can find w unique pieces to buy lots of museum and local bars

Very interesting and different. A very eclectic area, it contains some of the finest Middle Eastern food around. Some very interesting and unique shopping opportunities and it maintains the strong flavor of the Jewish neighborhood.

Balanced, central and a little different. Le Marais. Its for a little bit of everything you would like when wondering around a city - and at a pace that is relaxed, unlike many areas of major cities. Little shops and squares with narrow streets. Its mixed without feeling overpoweringly any one thing. Go there if you do Paris.

Funky area. The area of Paris is great for shopping, food, bars, and restaurants.
There is some great street artwork on walls - so keep a look out for that.
The area comes alive at night with people out socialising.
nice neighborhood. a nice neighborhood with plenty of bars, restaurants and shopping. a short walk from the pompidou museum. quite a few boutiques.

Best area to stay at while in Paris. Best area to visit on a weekend day or night. Full of life, restaurants, cafes, shops, etc.. A perfect choice for a couple or a family if you are looking for experiencing the real Paris. Away from the Champs Elysees and the Eiffel Tower areas. Le Marais is full of life and lights. Best area to visit on the weekend.

awesome quartier. great quartier, with muliple choise of eating, drinking, shopping, lots of great museums, lots of history, the best falafel in the world, one of the coolest cafés and gelattos in paris. a must-see!

Great tour of the Marais. I am an american living right outside of Paris and even though i live here, there are still places I am not that familiar with. I wanted to know more about the Marais district, so I booked an Eye Prefer Paris tour, as from their reviews it looks like it's the tour they specialize in. My husband and I met Richard at the Saint Paul metro stop and first thing was he gave us a map of the Marais, which was very useful. Richard was warm and friendly and also funny. He said there were mandatory stops on the tour for free chocolate samples and for pastry and coffee at an award winning bakery. My husband and I are big foodies, so the pastry and chocolate stops were great. Richard showed us all the wonderful food shops in the Marais and we especially loved the Mid-east gourmet shop Izrael, where i picked up a few things plus another shop that only sold foie-gras. Richard also pointed out some of his favorite restaurants in the area, and we enjoyed lunch at one of them after the tour. We learned a lot of interesting history which I didn't know before and also saw a delightful hidden rose garden we never would have found on our own. I will definitely take another Eye Prefer Paris tour again soon.
Nice area. Very trendy and arty, historical too.Do not miss the Place des Vosges, and do some shopping, Picasso museum is a must do too.
Ideal on Sunday.. Nice ambience. Lively. Interesting boutiques which are open on a Sunday. Museum Desmaret (?) worth a visit as is the beautiful Place des Vosges

A must see area of Paris. Lovely windy streets with galleries, shops, restaurants - everything. Beatiful area. I have always loved searching for areas I missed last time. Have to go to the place des Voges. Very famous. Avoid eating at Ma Bourgogne - costs a lot and they do NOT accept credit cards. One can only imagine why. Cash business. So it you have an ethical problem with this then choose any of 100 other lovely bistros.

Historic and quaint, a must visit neighborhood in Paris.. The Marais is a quaint Jewish neighborhood in Paris. Full of eclectic, one of a kind shops and boutiques, it also has some of the best restaurants and Bistros. The Museum Carnavalet is situated here, which highlights the history of Paris and is well worth a visit. Highly recommend a stroll through this area, especially on a Sunday as most of the shops are open.

Essence of the old Paris. Le Marais is a famous Paris district on the right bank of the River Seine. Its lovely narrow streets are full of charming buildings of historic and architectural value. Iconic places like the Hotel de Ville and Place des Vosges are situated in this beautiful district. These must-see places, together with many interesting museums, old churches, and other significant historic buildings, are the essence of the old Paris. Combined with countless charming little shops, cafés, and restaurants, this wonderful area makes for an ideal place to take a leisurely stroll and soak up the magical atmosphere of old-time Paris.
The old Jewish quarter of paris. An interesting visit through the history of the Jewish community of Paris . A lot of Jewish shops and kosher restaurants . Also a shopping area .

My favorite arrondissement. Wherever you walk, it's a pleasure.... the clean and tidy buildings, the shops, the little hotels and bars, the grocery stores displaying their goods outside, the feel... it's very unique in the Marais.... of course it comes with a price, everything is quite expensive there in terms of hotels, etc.... it's worth it though...
Bohemian and Shopper Delight. Go for the Picasso Museum and the Pompidou Center and stay for little cafes, grocery stores, boutiques, high and low, restaurants and people watching.

The bohemian part of the greatest city in the world!. I didn't know anything about The Marais before I went to Paris. I walked throughout most of the center of the old city and was transfixed by the area immediately. Fascinating history and people everywhere. Jim Morrison apartment where he died is on a very quiet street with a small bar right across the street and that was surreal. I spent the whole day and night just wandering from street to street discovering something new at every corner. I am staying in a flat there this summer.

Accommodation and restaurants. We stayed at the 1k hotel in Le marais and tried a number of bars and restaurants. Loved this area as it is packed with eateries and we felt very safe here. Jim Morrison's final residence was in Le marais... Which is on our list for today
Worth a visit if you like small shops. This area is full of boutiques and pastry shops. If you want to have some crepes, eclairs, macaroons, etc., this area will be a good choice.
Nice!. Small streets, nice shopping. Avoiding the tourists is very hard, but you can still discover some quiet streets with beautiful shops.

A gorgeous area of Paris . Le Marais is an area full of history and differences. It has a magnificent park where you can picnic, watch the ducks, or just lie on the grass and relax. You can lunch in a chic restaurant or cafe or not far from the center is an old Jewish area that is full of falafel restaurants which have long lines to get in....A real treat. We were there on a Sunday afternoon whilst a Jewish wedding was taking place, it was quite wonderful to witness. A must see in Paris.
Beauti ful way to spend the afternoon. A lovely district to walk around in paris filled with shops, restaurants , galleries and coffee shops.

Village feel.. This is a gem of a place. We never tired of wandering around our local area with it's numerous bars, shops and restaurants. Great choice of eating options too from falafel to diners. Such a great place.

Unique part of a unique city. Le Marais is a very special part of Paris perfect to walk around and explore on foot.It has a wonderful mix of history, architecture, food, shopping and beautiful open gardens to enjoy. It's one of those places to take your and explore and enjoy what you find.

Cafe and food hub!. I love the vibe of Marais. It's like you want to try everything as you pass by every cafe. The architecture of old building are quite interesting. Quite small area but I love the vibe.

Stay here if you want to be central with a neighborhood feel. For our 6 day trip, we stayed entirely in Le Marais. A quick walk to many subway stations or attractions, yet a great area to call "home." My favorite activity was to sleepily walk to the neighborhood bakery down the street in the morning. Filled with shops for non-traditional souvenirs too!

Loved walking around here.. There were so any quaint cafes and beautiful patisserie.
Plus there are lots of shops open on a Sunday.
I love the traditional old and very grand buildings as well.
Not just for art lovers. Le Marais is getting very popular part of Paris for tourists as well as locals. There are many cool place to see and eat.

The beautiful and cultural Marais. I think this area of Paris would have to be my favourite. It reminds me of the Jewish quarter in Melbourne. Lovely intimate feel as it has small back streets, and lovely little cafes and restaurants. Fantastic. Great for people watching.

Art place that doesn't disappoint. Must see for all art lovers! Many free exhibitions, interesting boutiques and bar that inspire. The atmosphere is one of a kind. I recommend it for all modern art fans; you'll definitely meet some artists willing to speak about their work.
Fun to walk and explore. Loved the variety of ppl and culture here. Good spots to eat and have a drink. Even got a drink and an interesting bar with the boys ;)
Very Nice!. Didn't spend too much time here, just walked around. Busy area, lots of shops. Would like to return when I have more time.

Charming quartier. This carless neighbourhood is a delight to explore and one of the few places with shops open on a Sunday. Apart from shops there are plenty of restaurants, bars, cafes and patisseries/boulangeries and also little art and design galleries. It is small enough to go through on foot and it ends with the beautiful Place des Vosges. Highly recommend!

My favorite area in Paris. I love the bohemian lifestyle, the old buildings, the throngs of people window shopping or just enjoying a walk around the area. And I also love that this area has my favourite restaurant called, Cafe Musee, check it out in my other reviews.

Brilliant galleries, good coffe. Brilliant galleries, good coffe, grate street atmosphere... I spent hours wondering around small crooked medieval lanes all so alive with bars, restaurants, hotels, high and low fashion boutiques....

Walk in the Marais, have a look around.. The Marais is a mixed bag architecturally. I walked from Notre Dame across the river to the Marais - wanted to get to the BHV Department Store, saw so many great things on the way it took me much longer than I had planned, plus you walk across the Ile St. Louis, have to stop for a café and pretend you live there.
The heartbeat of Paris. A very lively area full of bistrots and shops, small streets and at the same time something new at every corner. Where Parisiens live. Charming

took exxcellent 3 hour tour of the Marais with eye prefer paris. just seeing the local sites, the architecture, churches, quaint shops, & having our guide, richard, give us the inside scoop on so many sites in the area.
Great area to walk about . Lots of cute designer shops , cafes and bars . Cobbled streets and pretty architecture. Great for romantic strolls or Sunday brunch.
Quirky. Great area to walk around , especially on a Sunday. Interesting shops and alleyways. Beautiful area.

Beautiful architecture but a tourist trap. 25 years ago le Marais was kind of authentic, but now it's become like mainstream tourist attraction. The architecture is sill there, however. But it's a pity to find all those international brand stores everywhere. In my opinion this musy be damaging to le Marais and tourism industry in the long run.

Bohemian, Trendy and Chic all together!!. a blend of designers to little random shops, gourmet food to very trendy restaurants and bars, you have it all and more in Le Marais! plus fresh green market and superb ambience during the day! is Parisian at its best! LOVE IT

Paris, February, love is in the air. Le marais, - history, shopping, gallaries, relaxing . Carnavalet museum, is a place to learn more about Paris history. Wonderful art, and artifacts, that will recreate for you all centiries of Parisian life. And it's free of charge. Victor Hugo museum, place des Voges ,- place you cant miss visiting.

Lovely area to stroll around. A local Parisienne fellow recommended we get out of Saint Germain and head to Le Marais. I'm so glad we did. Lots of lovely shops, bars and foody places to eat in or take away. We stopped for wine, bought marmalade and strolled past the many food establishments. Great atmosphere. We were there around 7pm on a Saturday.
My favourite Paris! . Nothing to say: Le Marais has always been my favourite part of Paris: picturesque, open on Sundays, tons of little designer shops, bars, restaurants and historical places.

Great area to experience everyday Paris & good window shopping. This area , Le Marais, on Le Saint Antoine Blvd is very good area for window shopping, experience Paris like a Parisian, go to nice small shops almost hidden in small cobbled stone streets ....Very beautiful area and so much diversity, gay area, jewish neighborhood, thriving shopping area , Le Bastille is close
I just love this area!. Best Falafel I have ever had - Rue des Rosiers. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Paris. Amazing cafes and the Place des Vosges... mmmm...Love it!

Amazing . Fabulous area! We had a ball...Can't wait to return! Some lovely little restaurants and bars, independent shops and beautiful architecture. Grab a coffee and relax outside a cafe and watch the world go by

Good place. Good place chill out in Paris. Also us good because locals like to be arround there,
Specially sundays. Its a place where travellers go, the turist remain where the monuments.

Best arrondissement . I stayed in an apartment in le marais for my vacation and it was perfect! Le marais has so much to offer, it's right in the middle of Paris and easy walking distance to not only landmarks but also many easily accessible metro stations. Great shopping! Many high end shops (Chanel, Repetto, etc.) as well as lesser known shops (1951, the kooples) and everything in between like Nike, Gap, H&M and Zara. I also loved the le BHV department store. Less than a mile from Notre Dame, many museums and more cafes, bars and restaurants than one can count. On Sunday's there is a huge pop up flea market on Rue de Temple. Very clean, lots of families and definitely a young, trendy vibe here. Great neighborhood!

Getting touristy but still very French.. On great transport by metro, the most efficient public transport in the world I think. Lots of little streets to get lost in and discover lovely spots accidentally,

Until we went to La Marais, I found Paris kinda disappointing.. Paris was frankly underwhelming for a few days. And then we went to La Marais and found the charming, busy, interesting city we had been looking for. It's picturesque almost to a fault. Its nooks and crannies never failed to delight us. I hate clothes shopping, but even I was engaged and happy to shop at Alice a Paris. (Sadly, it closed shortly after we visited). Skip Champs du Mars; go to La Marais.

The gay district. A little back story, a friend told me to be careful around Le Marais and Oberkamf because I might stumble some Jewish gang who doesn't like Arabs or North Africans. I may be Asian but the Shemagh around my neck is shouting " I am Palestenian!".Anyway, I totally forgot about the warning. Another friend told me that there were nice restaurants in Le Marais. So, with a date (yup!), we went to Le Marais looking for a restaurant. In a dark corner, there were three men smoking, drinking and talking in french. I only picked up the word "Asian". The place was a little shady and looking around, I was the only Asian within 500 ft. As we proceeded deeper in Le Marais, I noticed men looking at me. Then the woman with me said, " Le Marais is the gay district of Paris."No wonder everything looks fabulous. I noticed all those gay bars and men trying to pick up men. So, for gay men looking for a thrill, write Le Marais to your list.
Great place for shopping!. You can find some really interesting boutiques there and small bistros all around. Popular with young people!
Diversity. Marais is a charming neighborhood in Paris. At night you can enjoy restaurants of any kind of food, bars, pubs and many other options to have some fun.

Great Especially on a Sunday. Ended up visiting on a Sunday with the understanding that it includes Paris' Quartier Juif. It was a great choice. The area was open and welcoming. Chose to try L'As de Fallafel (23 Rue de Rosiers) for a very good schwarma sandwich to go--the line to be seated was over 30-minutes long. Note: Marais is in both the 3e and 4e arrondissement.
loved it!. Absolutely gorgeous neighborhood.. we loved walking, shopping, eating and then walking some more to repeat everything all over again in the same order!

Great shopping and food. Home to "the best croissant in Paris" among other delicacies. Plenty of see and be seen bars. Great boutique shopping and possibly the only shopping available on Sunday's. Protip- go in January for all the "soldes"
Jewish Ghetto with a chic vibe. Beautiful area in Paris with chic shops and some casual restaurants (several Kosher) Memorial to Holocaust victims is a main historical attraction.
Must visit area!. I love this area. Lots of popular attractions, restaurants, and souvenir shops! Very diverse area.Highly recommend!

Its about the food. This area is speckled with numerous specialty food vendors. French cheeses, charcuterie, spices, chocolates, boulangeries, wines. If you can book a food crawl you can get a taste of everything and learn why the French are the masters of all things edible!
Lovely area. I've been going to Paris for a long time and I had the pleasure of discovering this area last summer. There are lovely little shops and restaurants .. all very quaint !

Just fantastic. This is the old town and is simply staggering in terms of the architecture and sheer size. The shopping is really outstanding in this area and I'd advise spending some time in the many boutique stores here to discover why Paris is known for its fashion. Another thing that I feel is really important is to go to Hotel De Ville first and input that as a location to reach in your map. I used the standard Tripadvisor location marked and while it takes you there the point is definitely not as impressive as Hotel De Ville.

Love to walk through Marais whenever we visit. We love to walk through Marais whenever we visit Paris. We love to window shop at the beautiful boutiques and sample the food in the area. We hoped to stop in galleries this trip, but were in Marais too early, and nothing was open yet. Will have to go back.

amazing neighborhood with everything you need. We did A LOT of research before heading to Paris so that we could maximize our trip. Adventurouskate.com (a blog) gave us lots of great info, including where to stay in Paris-I highly recommend reading her blog posts to find what you are looking for. We took her advice and found a tiny place on airbnb right in the heart of Le Marais! Le Marais is fab: several great restaurants, lots of boutique shops and vintage shops, the BHV (a large Parisian dept store), vintage shops, and walking distance to many metro stations. The vibe in this neighborhood is wonderful! Walking distance to Notre Dame, Hotel de Ville, Centre Pompidou, the Picasso Museum, Shakespeare and Co bookshop and café, St. Chapelle, and more! When I return to Paris I will stay in Le Marais again.

Lovely, less-traveled, but chic Parisian neighborhood. This section of Paris started getting chic after they opened the Pompideau Center here, in 1977. Today the Pompideau attracts thousands of tourists (for good reason,) but the neighborhood remains chic, but still charming, with narrow streets full of small boutiques and cafes, a few boutique hotels (Le Petit Marche!,) but no crowds like you find on the Left Bank. The Picasso Museum is a wonderful addition. If I could live anywhere in Paris, it would be right here.

Heart and Soul of Paris. Many proclaim this is the best neighborhood in Paris, which I won't completely disagree with, although I preferred Montmartre (Arrondissement 18). If cobbled streets and narrow alleys are what you envision the city to be, then this is your cup of tea. But this district (Arrondissement 3) doesn't have the vibrancy and energy of others like the Latin Quarter (Arrondissement 5) or Saint Germain (Arrondissement 6), which some feel are more touristy than Le Marais. Regardless of what you're looking for, all the aforementioned neighborhoods are worth a visit to see every facet of Paris.

One of the best places to stay. Love le Marais! We have stayed in a lot of areas in France but i think this is the best. Shopping is great, there are fewer designer stores and a lot of eclectic stores. Food is cheaper and the variety is also better. Make sure you take note of your position or get a map... It is very easy to get lost here with many lanes and tall buildings there is little to navigate from as landmarks ate hard to get a glimpse of. I got lost several times. It is close to Notre Dame. One place to really challenge you is the metro at Chatelet and des Halles. A labyrinth to say the least. All you men out there please do ask directions or you will have a long walk and be exhausted after simply finding the correct exit. This is a good place to stay if you are visiting the maison object trade fair as the metro goes straight there. No need for cabs etc and then you are back in the heart of Paris instead of being stuck out at the airport or Villpinte with nothing to do. Metro costs 17.50 return for two to the exposition center
Taste of Paris and all its varieties. old and new, great place to walk, visit, shop, eat.....watch people, listen to people, enjoy...always our favorite

Nothing better on a beautiful day in Paris. Nothing is better than the Marais on a sunny Sunday afternoon in Paris. I love the Marais on Sunday because almost everythign is open and it is filled with wonderful small boutiques, yummy sandwich and flafal's.

Get lost in the heart of Paris with countless clothing shop. Beside all the luxury shop that you see, you wonder where the young Parisien go enjoy and buying clothing. There it is. Walking here will help you understand more about French culture with many beautiful coffee shop as well as many clothing stores for young people.
Great neighborhood. We loved walking around and exploring this neighborhood. Feels calmer than other areas of Paris, yet great restaurants and shops.

One of my favourite places in Paris. Lovely neighbouehood wirh charming lanes, full of many nice little shops-tee-mariage frere, great cheese, etc., etc. Lovely Place des Vosges-.Nice coffees&restaurant&good to go around&enjoy.

I suggest Le Marais to the travelers to stay. I suggest Le Marais to the travelers to stay. we are stay at a hotel and from there we walked from all Paris on foot. In the area you find everything from cafes, restaurants and stores very well for shopping. definitely if we are going to visit again Paris I will stay there again.
Love exploring in the Marais. Shopping in the boutiques and second hand stores is great here. Save room for falafels. They are SO good. People watching also great.

Trendy shopping and cultural area. When we last visited this area, probably 10 years ago, it was a bit of a back water. Now it is thriving and the little back streets host a throng of fashion shops housed in beautiful old buildings. Museums and interesting sights are often free (Victor Hugo house, Cognac-Jay museum and others). A visit to the Place des Vosges is a must as is the newly renovated Picasso Museum.
Voted Coolest Neighborhood Visited by my Kids. We loved the nighborhood - very trendy with nice restaurants, and not touristy at all. Great art galleries and architecure. Must see.

Our favorite neighborhood in Paris. So glad we took some time to explore Le Marais. We trekked up the hill our first night in Paris, and it set a perfect stage for our stay. Such a beautiful neighborhood with character around every turn. We found an adorable cafe for some wine and a snack and enjoyed the view of Paris below us. After visiting Sacre Coeur, we found an amazing steakhouse with the friendliest people, delicious fondue and memorable experience. A wonderful corner of Paris.

A vibrant place to stay . We have visited the area several times over the years and it is always interesting and full of flavour. The place is full of interesting eating places, shops and places of interest. A place not to miss.

You have to go there. Le Marais is one of the most interesting and alive neighbourhood in Paris. It is full of bistros, restaurants,boutique shops, art galleries, museums ( Centre Pompidou,Victor Hugo,etc) , street artists. It is the place where you can spend an entire day wondering on the streets, enjoying a lunch, listening from opera to pop music on the street, having a coffee.

Best Neighborhood. IMO - le Marais is a marvelous location. If you could afford the time, you could easily spend a week within it, experiencing all it has to offer, never venturing out to other arrondissements. A superb home base to observe and experience Parisian life.

Take you time to explore. This area has so much to offer, for foodies, photographers and shoppers. It's filled with restaurants and boutique shops, small art galleries and bars. There are lovely buildings and of course the beautiful Place des Voges.

THE BEST NEIGHBORHOOD IN PARIS: Tourists, go AWAY!. Really, I live here, I know. Le Marais is my favorite neighborhood in the city, no in France, NO... in THE WORLD! Everything is amazing about this neighborhood: the restaurants, the shopping, the fashion, the LOCAL people, the atmosphere and vibe. Its unbeatable.

Eclectic and Lively. We found this neighborhood to be lively and eclectic. Our studio apartment was across the street from an elementary school, we were next to a grocer and baker, and very near hair salons, clothing stores, all sorts of shops and restaurants. The people we encountered in the restaurants and shops were uniformly helpful and friendly. It's an interesting, artsy, place good for all sorts of people from families to young singles, professionals. Many of the buildings date back to the 1500s. We're glad we chose it for the location as well - walking distance to Ile de la Cite, the Louvre, Les Halles, Centre Pompidou, and many convenient subway stops. It also houses an outstanding science/technical museum, Arts et Metiers, that began in 1799. as well as Place Vosges, a 17th century residential square now full of shops, galleries and restaurants. It surrounds a lovely small urban park.All in all, Le Marais is a fascinating neighborhood.

Beautiful old quartier. We stayed at Le marais, and I really liked.It is so closed to the center, and at the same time away of the crowd.I liked wondering streets, and you have a lot to see, there are still ancient shops, and antiques shops. Very interested part of Paris, so unique.

Trendy local neighbourhood popular amongst artists and foodies. Had a great 5 days in the Marais. There is so much to see here, and the plethora of local small clothe shops and restaurants kept us perpetually occupied. There are a range of hotels and plenty of active street life to take in. Less touristy than other areas of Paris yet still full of things to do and see.

So much to see, take your time. Often people tell me they get confused in the Marais and arent quite sure exactly where it starts and ends. The Marais has many different areas so worth checking out.Metro Saint Paul - take rue pavée and wander the streets and you will stumble across some famous areas;- rue des rosiers : Jewish quarter famous for falafels and rose bakery- rue francs bourgeois : shopping and galleries and museums - rue de veille temple : cafes, shops - continue further north in the toward rue de Bretagne : marche des enfants rouge (good place for lunch), creperies (breizh cafe)- rue de turenne : good for men's clothing (suits etc)

If you want to shop boutiques.... This is the place to go. The whole area is exploding with shops, galleries, restaurants and cafes. Without a doubt my favorite area after St. Germain des pres. Formerly Jewish quarter it is now super diverse and fun. Things are always happening there. Right next to Centre Pompidou it's great for couples, solo, families and anyone looking to explore and shop!

Aaahhhh... Le Marais. What a such nice place. I stayed here for 10 days with my wife (celebrating our Anniversary) and we simply LOVED the neighborhood. A lot of bistros, easy access to several subway stations, just 5min walking from Notre Dame Cathedral. Definitely I will stay here again. My new favorite place in Paris.

Walking in the Marsh. One of the great walking experiences in Europe. This was once the home of the great and mighty of France and has resisted development with great success.A wonderful place for walking, gawping at the beautiful palaces and great houses, window shopping, sitting at street side cafes and people watching.Take a minimum of an hour - and preferably 3 or 4 to take in this area or you will miss an essential part of Paris.

Beautiful area to stay.. We stayed in an Airbnb - Symphony - in Le Marais and is was money well spent! The whole area was beautiful in every way, from the bakeries and restaurants to the boutiques and shops. Loved every day and didn't want to leave!

Best authentic neighborhood in Paris!. This neighborhood captures the true flavor of Paris. Close to the Picasso Museum, Rue De Rosiers (Jewish Quarter). Less touristy. We just loved the ambiance. I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Lovely area. We stayed in Airbnb here, it's great. On our first night we strolled around and were a bit underwhelmed, we just managed to miss the most interesting streets. So perservere. There's a great market which I think is weekend only, and it's just a great place to wander. We really liked the fact there was a bit of a multicultural feel, we ate some nice chinese, vietnamese and lebanese. Pompidou is nearby which is great, it's just a pretty cool area.

Walking in Paris = Place des Vosges and Le Marais. A traditional for us. After having a look at the art galleries and a short walk under the arcades , we like to tour those narrow streets, full of boutiques and mansions transformed in museum, such as Picasso museum.

The most beautiful quartier. It is wonderfull to walk around in this area. Nice streets with different types of shops, some markets and lots of beautifull buildings. Just wander around and get lost. Place de Vosges tops it all

I moved here. I'm working in Paris for 6 months or so and after walking through here I fell in love with the place and moved here. Great for shopping, lovely bars and restaurants and just very pretty!

One of the most beautiful areas in Paris. This sector was the MOST exclusive in all of Paris at the time of Louis XIII, the king himself had apartments overlooking the Place des Vosges, which is a must-se in the city. Many Parisian luminaries also lived there later like Victor Hugo whose apartment is now a museum, and Colette.It also has the Musee de la Chase et la Nature, which is one of the best in the city, with a great exhibition program, the decoration of the rooms there is simply out of this world, you have to see it to believe it: A room has a ceiling covered with antlers and horns, for example, another with owl heads and wings.The Jewish Museu, which has an excellent collection of Judaica and also has a great exhibition program and bookstore is also nearby.Aside form all this the are is EXCELLENT for shopping, if you like one of a kind shops this is your district, but they also have some major department stores.Last but not least this is the gay area of Paris so there is plenty of fashion, glamour and diversity. NOT to be missed.

A cool and different side of Paris. Typically I have always stayed on the Left Bank and hung out in 1re arrondissement when I have visited Paris. This year we decided to change it up and stay in Le Marais. I will do this forever now. I loved Le Marais - it is so cool and unique and chic. It is also one of the oldest parts of the city with incredible history to read and learn about. There are some amazing restaurants of all different cuisines. Being in this part of town makes you feel much less touristy and much more of a local, which I love. Definitely will this forever now!

Fantastic quartier.. Love it here.The ambiance of real Paris is fantastic.You can find almost everything here: great restaurants, bars, boutiques, museums, parks, coffee shops, petit Boulangeries....It is cozy and chic!
Love this area. We have been to this area twice and have loved it both times. Be sure to visit Victor Hugo's home. It is free and beautiful. The Place des Voges is wonderful for people watching.
Best area to sleep,eat & shop. Always stay in Le Marais,for me it's the best area,close to everything plus exceptional cafes,restaurants and great for shipping.

My Favorite Neighborhood. Le Marais has almost everything you would want in a Parisian neighborhood. There are great restaurants, shops, museums, etc. It is also well served by public transportation. You can also just wander around and look at the architecture and the people.

walk. oldest area of paris ... place des vosges and the pink stones. the pastry shop Carette! the park and the benches it was so warm this year in pais in December! Picasso museum etc...pompidou center and its amazing view and the modern art collection... a must!

Stayed in an Air BnB apartment. We were in the north part in a secluded, quiet area but just down the street were cafes, a market and parks and the metro. Venture a little further and there were patisseries and bars.

Surreal streets to walk through. Visited after Christmas and it was wonderful just walking the streets and getting a bite a Las Du Fallafel. Lots to see and plenty of Parisian vibe to take in. Worth half a day.
Stunning. This is my favorite place in Paris. There is an exhibition about Marais right now. The Place des Voges is a must.

Fun shops throughout beautiful narrow streets. This was a fun day shopping. It naturally offers a very fun and vibrant vibe. Good shops of all variety and some good food too. There are a few good places to stop off and sit as you progress and get tired. Definitely worth a visit if you want shops and or architecture and good vibes.

The Marais has it all!. Restaurants, bars, shops, history, you will not be disappointed by spending time in this area. Take your time to check it out from Places des Vosges to the Rue des Roisiers, it's wonderful!
The best area to stay.. I loved the Marais. Great shopping, many good restaurants, and jazz clubs. Has a more local feel than the touristy areas.

Fascinating place to visit. By chance, our hotel was at the north end so we wandered round Le Marais at some point on each day we stayed. Lots of little shops, restaurants and bars and old buildings and museums. Clean and very little graffiti unlike most of Paris. Would want to stay in the Marais when we return to Paris

new find. I have been going to Paris for years and I am not sure how I have missed this wonderful little neighborhood nestled between the tourist traps. The shops are cool little places and you can get some take homes that you will appreciate.

I love Le Marais. It's always a pleasure to wander around Le Marais.
Cool shops & bars , a great place to hangout in the evening .
Amazing that it was once one of Paris's seedier neighbourhoods .
The Place to Go. This place has everything.Shops,bars and the works.The streets can keep you busy for hours shopping or just sight/people watching.Go there for the Parisian Atmosphere.
Come see the art galleries.. Our brief visit consisted of walking through the area and visiting some art galleries. It is a historic district of Paris with many beautiful buildings and hotels.

Interesting neighborhood. We rented an apartment here and found it to be very centrally located for many Paris attractions. You can find the amazing Picasso museum here as well at the Pompidou center. The shopping is great as lots of small shops and boutiques. We also found that we could stay in the area for all our dinners.

When you get lost - find a cafe and have a glass of wine.. The winding streets of Le Marais is filled with shops, museums, and restaurants - more than enough to keep you busy for several days. Sunday afternoon the place was filled with people - both tourists and locals. Everyone was having a blast - the streets of this neighborhood do not have the slightest feeling of being touristy - loved just roaming around, getting lost, then finding a place to sit to rest and reorient ourselves.

Love the shops...gives lots of nice ideas ;-)) Very inspirational. I love the Marais,everything is so relax over there,and sometimes you think your walking in a village and not a big city like Paris...very nice shops...more quality stuff ...love it!! If you haven't visited...please don't hesitate!!

One of the most interesting mix of cultures in Paris!. We finally made it to Le Marais on our third visit to Paris. It is most unique because it is an area once famous for its aristocrats and the imposing architecture of their homes, which now includes the LGBT community and the Jewish Quarter. We used the Rick Steves self-guided tour to hit the highlights, including a visit to Victor Hugo's home at the Place des Vosges. Make sure you see this part of Paris sometime!
Great for the vintage shopper. I highly recommend for the vintage shopper Free P star is my favorite and love this area for unique boutiques , history and overall ambiance

Old Jewish and gay area.. This is a very colorful and interesting part of the city. On the right bank it offers the Place de Voges , a beautiful set of buildings built around a park which has top notch art galleries and the home of Victor Hugo which is open to the public. There is also the dramatic Place de la Bastille with a grand obelisks in the center. The Bastille is long gone. There are also several small but interesting museums in the area and a few classic French resrptaurants including Cafe Bofinger, the local of many scenes in the novels of Alan Furst.
Best area of Paris. Eclectic is the word for this area - it has got everything - bars, restaurants, good shopping, great people and history.

One of Paris' oldest and most atmospheric quarters. Originally a muddy marshland ( marais means marsh), until Henri IV drained the area and built the Place Royale in 1605, the area is one of Paris' oldest and most atmospheric quarters. Once the area of the birthplace of the French Revolution, the district sank into disrepair until renewal in the 1960's. Now the location of museums, restored mansions, and narrow streets lined with cafes and restaurants, the area is a wonderful place to discover a genuine Paris neighborhood. Don't miss Musee Carnavalet and Musee Picasso

Wish I lived in Le Marias. My husband and I stayed in Le Marias on our brief stop to Paris on our honeymoon and we just loved it. It was everything I imagined Paris would be.The atmosphere was of course quite subdued due to the attacks but I felt that the Parisian spirit was still there and I hope to return one day to feel the atmosphere during a peaceful time.I would also like to see the tree lined boulevards in summer, and partake in the bistros during warm weather.We loved the eateries that were everywhere in Le Marias, but I particularly loved the small boutiques. I purchased a lot of Christmas presents that are so lovely and unique, and I would recommend a day wandering around just to see the boutiques and food shops. I honestly dream of living on Le Marias someday.
Cool area. Cool area great for those who love to shop! Lots of little boutiques bars and cafes. A great little wine bar to visit is Le voltigeur

good place. Went on rainy day , so a bit gloomy but on good day would be good.
worth visiting , good photo opportunities.

Le Marais. Cosy and friendly quarter - despite of what happened recently. Jewish part & ditto museum are well-worth a visit. Paris is lovely - especially in december, with nog too many tourista around ...

Great Neighborhood. Arguably one of the best areas to stay in Paris. Great shops, restaurants, bars and museums. Visit the Picasso Museum while there, explore the different streets and drink till morning.

my favorite. in paris its always my favorite place to stay. on sundays you have a great atmosphere...and every night you have something going on in the bars / cafes and restaurants. the old but gold paris is here.
shopping experince. This area is good for shopping with nice streets and old church. most luxurious brands are found there.

The best of Paris. The only Place you have to visit to get the Paris-vibe. In Le Marais you can get lost in the labyrinth of small and charming streets, shop high-end fashion, visit nice coffee shops etc. etc.
Walking, shopping!. My husband and I spent an afternoon at Le Marais. There are many quaint shops to spend your vacation money.
Great area. Nice shops on the edge of the 2nd and 3rd arrondissement. Rue des petits carreaux and Rue montegeuil are very cosy streets with lots of nice restaurants and bistrots.

Lovely!. This is a lovely and vibrant area of Paris and I love exploring this part of the city. I even decided to stay in this area in my last trip to Paris so I strongly recommend if you like busy and lively areas.

Great place to stay!. A great place to stay! Highly recommend it! Great energy and location- if you want to travel into the centre of Paris everyday and you are on a budget- Le Marais is a fantastic option. We ate in many great restaurants, (which vary in price) but many different options of breakfast to dinner.

Great way to unwind on a Sunday afternoon. The main reason that we'd gone to Le Marais was to shop on a Sunday afternoon. The area is filled with a good combination of small boutiques and chain stores. If you get tired of walking around, you can duck into the many cafés and restaurants to refresh yourself or watch the street musicians. Keep watch over your valuables as it can get very busy in this area.

Go there and eat a Falaffel sandwich. Our daughter wanted to go to this area just for the food. So, we did of course. Wish we had stayed longer and looked around more. The food was great. Ate Jewish French pastries. They were lovely and different than the ones that we ate elsewhere. Basically, do to all the arrondissements.

enjoyable walking and dining. My wife and I have walked through all of the well-known Paris neighborhoods a few times and this is more interesting than some and less interesting than others. Personally I prefer St. Germain or Latin Quarter as well as Chatelet area just for walking around, but on the other hand, I prefer Marais to for example Louvre area or Belleville. If you are in Paris for more than a few days, you should definitely walk through this district for something to eat or just a walking tour or similar.

Great district to mooch in - boasting culture, food and shops!. A delightful area - full of narrow streets and shops. There are also a number of very good (and free!) museums located here. Make sure to include it on your itinerary.
Great for atmosphere and interesting shops. This is my favourite place to shop and stay in Paris. It has an interesting and lively ambience and many many restaurants cafes and shops to delight.

A wonderful elegant neighborhood in the center of Paris. Visiting this neighborhood takes you to the glorious elegant past of the city. Recommended to take the free tour, to learn more than meets the eye.

Brilliant part of Paris to stay. We stayed in an apartment here in rue de la Verrerie, near the Hotel de Ville Metro. It was an excellent 'home base' for us to walk Paris. The area is so very interesting - history, cultural, social - and has a buzz all the time. Close to the Seine, Pompidou Centre, shopping and many,many wonderful bistros and restaurants and we spent most of time in the Marais just enjoying every minute.

Perfect for a sunday stroll. Old jewish center of Paris, now an "in-Place" with a lot of jewish life again. All shops open on sunday afternoon, lot of bistros, Café and restaurants. Absolutely a place to go!

High end shopping, beautiful winding streets. Highly recommended attraction in Paris. If you are looking for high end fashion (think Sandro, not Gucci) this is the place. If you are not into shopping, go for the beautiful winding streets and the history of the old Jewish quarter. Stay for the crepes and a glass of wine at Creperie Suzette. A wonderful way to spend the day and not far from the center of Paris.

Do not understand why it is famous.. It is an old Jewish settlement in Paris. There are several falafel take out eateries. I do not understand why so many people wait in line to buy some ordinary falafel. The falafel is not bad but the persons making the food seems to be low paid terribly hard worker.

the heart of Paris. The heart of Paris beats right here - it is one of the nicest quarters and one of the few places in Europe where you get a decent bagel. Le Marais is great for a nice afternon flow - from café to boutique to boutique to boutique and back to another café.

I wouldn't stay anywhere else!. One of the (so far) least touristic and evocative arrondisements. Stay in the heart of an arty, fashionable, foody area with great museums and only a walk along the Seine to the Louvre!
My Favorite District. Great boutiques. Great restaurants. Surprisingly within walking distance of everything if you're in Paris with good weather. My neighborhood!

My Favorite Community in Paris - Close to EVERYTHING. The Marais is my favorite part of Paris because it is so close to everything and incredibly charming. Lots of shops and unique architectural wonders, churches and still-visible Medieval charms. Formerly a working-class and Jewish neighborhood, the Mariais was Napoleon's favorite part of Paris (he called it "the jewel" of Paris). If you love history, of course, all of central Paris is wonderful, but the Mariais is within walking distance of almost anything and everything you would want to see on a first visit and a little less expensive and extravagant than the communities near the Eiffel Tower. Wonderfully diverse and the best walks ever.
Lovely Paris area !. Away from the usual touristical Paris sites you may enjoy the Marais. With its lovely small restaurants, little shops and delicious foodmarket, as well as small artgalleries.

wonderful walking neigborhood. Just walk everywhere and enjoy the sites especially, Place des Vosges, a beautiful park. On an earlier trip we went to Musee Carnavalet (about Paris, my favorite), Musee Picasso. If you want to go the Museum of Jewish History and Art remeber they are closed on the sabbath and Jewish holidays so check before you go.

Great part of Paris for nightlife, local flavour, restaurants, shopping. . A great part of town that has it all. Spend at least a late day into evening here if you can't spend he night here. Hip friendly and a great feel to modern Paris. Enjoy

Stayed in Villa Beaumarchais nearby.. A fortunate choice. This lively district showed several facets of Parisienne life - locals and visiters - and was readily accessible via the excellent Metro. We found several small restaurants and bistrots we likd, There are dozens.
A foodie paradise. I'm sure there are plenty of other things going for this area in Paris, but if you're a foodie, this is one of the places you must put on your to do list.

Worth for a walk. Make a walk absolutelly a nice morning. Drink coffee. Go to the Place des Vosgues. There is also a museum on corner of it. Beautifull little roads for a promenade! And tiny shops with book, antiques, furniture and clothes. There you can find a Musee de la Magie.

Wonderful old town. Le Marais is a wonderful old district of Paris. It's a nice walk around the winding streets, looking at all the historic buildings, most with smart boutiques on the ground floor. Keep walking until you find yourself in the old square full of galleries and cafes and enjoy people watching.

Fabulous area. Staying in the Marais allowed us to stay away from the most heavily touristed areas. Restaurants and cafes surround you and make it easy to choose a different spot to eat for every meal. People are friendly and really supportive when you use your French to communicate.

A great area to explore.. The Marais is a busy and very interesting area in which to stay. The rest of Paris is close at hand and there are a variety of shops and bars to suit all tastes. There are lots of museums nearby from art museums to cultural and historical museums. It is easy to walk to most places in Paris and The Marais is well situated for most areas. For the young and hip there are many well known brands - Uniqlo, Cos, Zadig and Voltaire, Sandro, Paul and Joe etc.as well as Chanel and the other designer shops. We stayed in Rue Charlot - a quiet street with many designer shops.
Great musemuns and shopping. In Le Marais is the newly renovated Picasso museum which is outstanding. There is also the Musee Carnavalet. Many great stores to shop at.

Don't miss Le Marais for a walkabout. Visitors to Paris shouldn't miss a walkabout in the Marais --- both the 3rd and the 4th arrondisement. Great boutique shops and lovely built environment. Not the best value cuisine in the world but great options and some exceptional upper mid-range options.
Cosy. A vivid and enjoyable part of Paris. Living all the time with its bars, pubs and restaurant and it's architecture. Also a nice place to go shopping.
My favorite part of Paris. Great shopping Good food. Beautiful architecture. This is old Paris of narrow streets, small shops and the Place des Vosges is magnificent.
A must visit. Strolling thou the Marais past the shops cafes museums etc. place des voges, the people - is not to be missed. No matter where we stay we always spend at least a day in the Marais.
Pleasant area to visit. DIY walking tour of the Marais - fascinating area to explore - wife found to many shoe shops for comfort but an altogether pleasant couple of hours.

Le Marais the place to go. I'm french and I live in Paris so Le Marais is one of the greatest neighborhood in Paris. It's also called the homosexual neighborhood.I really love the Marais.
